alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grafton, or 10 miles southwest of Hoosick Falls, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Pownal, Grafton, Hoosick, Old Bennington, Cole Field, White Oaks, North Pownal, Petersburg Junction, Quackenkill, Potter Hill, Babcock Lake, Stillham, Tamarack, Petersburg, Pownal Center, East Grafton and North Petersburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
